description: Creates categorical graph for educational visualization.
example_usage:
# Example usage for create_categorical_graph
result = create_categorical_graph(data)

educational_standards.description: Interpret data with up to three categories.
Ask and answer questions about the number of data points in each category.
Ask and answer questions about how many more data points are in one category than in another.
Ask and answer questions about how many less data points are in one category than in another.
Draw a bar graph with a single-unit scale to represent a data set with up to four categories.
Solve simple put-together problems using information presented in a single-unit scaled bar graph.
Solve simple take-apart problems using information presented in a single-unit scaled bar graph.
Solve simple compare problems using information presented in a single-unit scaled bar graph.
Draw a scaled picture graph to represent a data set with several categories.
Draw a scaled bar graph to represent a data set with several categories
Solve problems on scaled bar graphs.

educational_standards.display_name: Analyze Bar Graphs: Two Step Problems
educational_standards.description: Solve two-step additive-comparison problems that require combining or comparing results from categorical data represented in a pictograph, or bar graph with scaled intervals.
Interpret a picture graph.
Interpret a scaled bar graph.
Identify samples that are representative, random or biased.
Understand that a set of data collected to answer a statistical question has a data distribution which can be described by its center, spread, and overall shape.

Understand that a set of data collected to answer a statistical question has a data distribution which can be described by its center, spread, and overall shape.
Understand that a set of data collected to answer a statistical question has a data distribution which can be described by its center, spread, and overall shape.
Recognize that a measure of center for a numerical data set summarizes all of its values with a single number.
Interpret and analyze data presented in tables, charts, and graphs to solve problems involving measures of center, frequency, and percentages.
Display numerical data on histograms.
Interpret numerical data on histograms.
Report the number of observations of data from a math problem.
Report the number of observations of data from a math problem.
Report the number of observations of data from a math problem.
Report the number of observations of data from a math problem.
Report the number of observations of data from a math problem.
Report the number of observations of data from a math problem.

educational_standards.display_name: Finding Quantitative Measures from Charts and Graphs
educational_standards.description: Interpret charts and graphs to find mean, median, mode, and range.
